body.name: Sceptre 4K IPS 27" 3840 x 2160 UHD Monitor up to 70Hz DisplayPort HDMI 99% sRGB Build-in Speakers, Black 2021 (U275W-UPT)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 18 mins
features: Superior 4K Picture: Delivering 4x the pixels (8 million) of FHD, 4K (3840 x 2160) resolution offers an extraordinary landscape of color variation, contrast, and clarity that mirrors the real world.Mounting Type: Wall Mount
Viewing Angle is 178° (H) / 178° (V); Aspect Ratio is 16:9
IPS Panel: The IPS (In-Plane Switching) panel cannot be beat when it comes to consistently delivering top color performance & sharp visibility from multiple viewing angles.
up to 70Hz Refresh Rate: With 75Hz refresh rate, images change faster and smoother than the standard, reducing screen tearing
350 Brightness: Detect impressively subtle & robust color variations with 350 cd/m² brightness.

Multiple Ports: The DisplayPort accelerates refresh rate up to 70Hz, providing the visual edge you need to defeat the competition during all of your gaming exploits. HDMI 1 delivers sharp 4K images at 60Hz while HDMI 2 and 3 deliver this remarkable resolution at 30Hz. Connect your favorite audio devices with Audio Out.
body.description: Sceptre’s U275W-UPT monitor is the perfect candidate for productivity and entertainment that are dependent on vibrant images. Whether it’s for photo-editing, watching movies, light gaming or web-browsing, this monitor has you covered. Powered by an IPS (In-Plane Switching) Panel that delivers consistent and accurate color performances, this panel provides sharp visibility from multiple angles. Delivering 4x the pixels of FHD, 4K (3840 x 2160) resolution offers an extraordinary landscape of color variation, contrast, and clarity that mirrors the real world. Offering a 350 cd/m² brightness, being able to detect subtle and robust color variations is easier and comes in handy when working on creative projects with remarkably vivid colors illuminating the screen like never before. Photo-editing or gaming for long hours? Equipped with 99% sRGB, the U275W-UPT offers a wider color gamut than most conventional monitors, contributing to the delivery of deeper colors and defining features. Whether it’s for creative projects or entertainment purposes, such as light gaming or video viewing, the image provided is incomparable to other displays. For your light gaming entertainment, images change faster and smoother than the standard monitor with up to 70Hz refresh rate that reduces screen tearing and ghosting. With a response time of 5ms, reducing the amount of blurring while transitioning pixels provides an advantage over your enemies as they stay precisely in focus during chaotic moments that require all of your attention. Anti-flicker technology is also available to provide a crisper image by preventing the backlight from flickering periodically. Blue Light Shift application is also available to reduce the emission of blue light from your monitor, enabling the ability to work, view, and play for longer hours while protecting your eyes from fatigue, irritation, and strain. FPS (First Person Shooter) and RTS (Real-Time Strategy), Sceptre’s custom set display settings for gaming, are available for a more enhanced experience. Delivering robust and smooth audio, this monitor also includes built-in speakers suitable for work and gaming settings, assisting with the process of saving space on your desk. Multiple ports are also offered, with DP 1 delivering up to 70Hz, HDMI 1 delivering sharp 4K images up to 60Hz, and HDMI 2 & HDMI 3 delivering up to 30Hz refresh rates. With an equipped VESA wall mount pattern, enjoy the option of attaching the monitor to an articulating arm or mount on the wall for your ideal setup. Worried about someone stealing your monitor? Worry not. With the security lock feature, you are now able to securely fasten your monitor in place, preventing damage or theft. So what are you waiting for? With a 4K resolution that mirrors what you see in the real world,, powered by an IPS panel with 350 cd/m² brightness and 99% sRGB color gamut, this monitor has amazing assets suitable for all creative projects and viewing entertainment. Add in our sleek edgeless design and your working, gaming, and viewing experience has never looked better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible picture and quality for the price without wasted frills.
reviews.reviewText: Since HDR isn't really all that great without like 1000nits anyways, and I'm using this for my mac studio as a work screen, I don't care about gaming or refresh rate (though 70hz is nice). I expected less than what this monitor gives. The stand is very sturdy and has a smaller footprint than the LG Ultrafine 27UN850-W it replaces. Picture is brighter and clearer after some basic adjustments. Color is perfectly -fine- if you're not a designer, especially at this price point. I will never test the speakers. I'm using a thunderbolt to display port adapter and everything works great. I love that there's not a bunch of gimmicky random features no one ever uses that usually aren't very well implemented in the first place like my other monitors, so it feels like I'm simply paying for a solid, reliably 32" 4k monitor and that's what I got. Had it for a few days now and as for it's sturdiness, I accidentally let this slip out of the box as I was opening it and it fell onto my polished concrete floor about a foot and a half and had zero cracks or anything. I was worried but no dead pixels or anything at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I Use for Productivity, Never Gaming
reviews.reviewText: I don't game, so this review is solely for productivity purposes.I bought two of these for work and they are fantastic. Picture is super clear, no scratches, dead pixels, etc. when I purchased. I wanted 4K to have a really clear image for reading documents and working in excel. I know this is probably overkill for work, but I used monitors with less resolution before these (at home was 1920 x 1080p and at work was 2560 x 1440p) and I think the difference is worth it in my opinion. I'm nitpicky about these things though and I usually don't like to settle for less if I can afford something better that isn't an outrageous price. These are priced very low but the product doesn't compare to the cost. You could buy from Samsung or LG at twice or triple the price and the differences would be nil.If you don't mind having an off-brand monitor that still works just as well as the name brand and for half the price, you should go with this monitor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value 4k display
reviews.reviewText: Looks great! I'm really satisfied to get a second 4k monitor for reading things in 4k at such a decent price (about 200).Pros:-Contrast ratio between white/blacks seems great, especially for LCD screen tech-Viewing angles seem good, legit IPS display-Screen resolution is as advertised, easy set up-Pretty stable base with a decent tilt functionCons:-Speakers suck, but hopefully you're not buying it for that-I don't think this contains the DRM that you need to play Netflix in 4k, but I used my TV for that-Screen refresh rate is only 60-70 Hz, so that's pretty noticeable if you're used to one of those 120-144 Hz refresh screens (but you're not getting that at 4k at any price nearby this!)-Base does not do adjustable height (I guess buy a monitor arm or stand if that's important to you)Overall, no regrets on this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great monitor with a couple drawbacks
reviews.reviewText: The monitor is bright, clear, and has great resolution. The speakers and tinny and cheap sounding. I added external speakers, but it would have been nice to have to had better built in speakers so that I did not have to have external speakers taking up space on my desk.I didn't use my computer for a day. When I came back to use it the display would not turn on. I could not get the display's built in menu to come on. I tried disconnecting, connecting cables, using different display ports on the computer and on the display, and cycling power on both the display and the PC. It didn't start working again until I unplugged power to the display and then plugged back in. I noticed someone else in the comments reporting a similar experience that requires physically removing the power cable and then plugging back to get the display to come back on.I disabled the sleep function on the monitor and turned on the screensaver instead. This seems to have masked the problem. Hoping the monitor will last. I've only had it for a couple weeks, but like it so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent color, brightness, viewing angle, build quality
reviews.reviewText: Very impressed, I bought this after getting a bigger name brand for the same price that was terrible quality. This not only has a better screen but is built far more solid. Really like it! (Using it with a Macbook Air M2).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Pictures are beautiful, the colors are rich and it works great with my games

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful colors, great price, 120hz refresh rate
reviews.reviewText: Boosted it to 120Hz using the NVIDIA Control Panel. The value for a 4K 32" IPS monitor with an impressive refresh rate and stunning colors is unbeatable. Extremely satisfied with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This monitor is good for one thing only: Recommending to your enemies so they suffer!
reviews.reviewText: Why does this brand have such good reviews? This monitor is an utter piece of crap.Included speakers are so crappy, you could make your own set yourselves and put in there. This should not be a selling factor whatsoever.Monitor also came with a dead pixel, and the backlighting is uneven, very poorly made.I've had this for just a little over a year and the DisplayPort keeps stop working intermittently, and now stopped working completely.So if you want a monitor with a dead pixel, poor backlighting because it was misaligned during install, crappy speakers that you can't turn off and keep showing up as a sound source and sending all your audio to these speakers when you have better audio, and want your monitor to work intermittently causing you hours of frustration troubleshooting, oh and make room for a power brick, thing doesn't even use a standard power port.So again, recommend this to your enemies!!!! Otherwise, STAY CLEAR. Don't cheap out on monitors and just get a regular brand.

Colores muy conseguidos. El tipo de monitor es el indicado para los diseñadores y editores de imagen y video pues del tipo IPS, el mejor para este tipi de tareas, y este modelo llega hasta 99% en sRBG,el ideal es 100%, la mayoría andan desde 94% a 98%. 4K reales. Sorprendentemente maneja RBG con mezcla de CMYK en el ajuste de colores, si, maneja cian, amarillo y magenta junto al rojo, azul y verde. Veo mis películas y videos de youtube de 4k de resolución. No me arrepiento de haberlo comprado. Acepta HDMI y DP.
The image is good but material is very fragile mine cracked just from holding it.

Este monitor 4K Sceptre de 27 pulgadas es una excelente opciónsi buscas un monitor de alta calidad a muy buen precio, para tu computadora. Tiene una resolución máxima de 3840 x 2160 (4K), imágenes nítidas y colores vibrantes, ofrece una experiencia visual impresionante para ver videos, jugar juegos y trabajar en proyectos de diseño. Además, su pantalla IPS de gran ángulo de visión permite ver desde diferentes ángulos sin experimentar cambios significativos en la calidad de la imagen.El monitor Sceptre cuenta varias opciones de conectividad incluyendo3 puertos HDMI (1 para 4k)1 DisplayPortTambién tiene altavoces integrados pero estos no te brindaran la mejor experiencia de audio, de hecho son bastante malos y no es la realidad de por que compras este monitor, el audio lo uso con audífonos, las bocinas de la Mac, o monitores de audioSuper vale la pena! super recomendado, bueno bonito y barato, un JBL de tamaño similar en Walmart de 1080 cuesta 1,000 pesos más

Un monitor totalmente recomendable para trabajar. La imagen en 4K se ve perfecta, ayuda mucho que sea 27” por lo que la densidad de los pixeles por área es mucha. El brillo es muy bueno y tiene además 2 entradas HDMI y 2 DP para que se puedan conectar varios equipos al mismo tiempo. El cambio entre las entradas hay que hacerlo manual, pero es lo de menos. Tiene además una salida de audio para poder conectar audífonos o bocinas a manera de extensión.La base y el brazo que lo sostienen son metálicos y muy robustos. Sin embargo, no tienen movilidad. En mi caso lo tengo fijo con un brazo mecánico por lo que no me afecta.La velocidad de refresh es de 70Hz la cual sólo es posible con DP y en resolución UHD. Para juegos que no requieram de movimiento rápido, la imagen es bastante decente.La relación calidad precio es de las mejores.Totalmente recomendable

Lo compre con un poco de dudas por la marca pero no estoy decepcionado. La calidad de la imagen es muy buena. Los materiales también se sienten muy bien. Las bocinas se escuchan muy débiles pero lo tengo conectado a unas bocinas externas así que no me molesta. Para mis necesidades está excelente.
